newsitem.title: JAPAN: N.Korea seeks to join Asia Development Bank - daily.
newsitem.headline: N.Korea seeks to join Asia Development Bank - daily.

text.p: North Korea has applied to join the Asian Development Bank (ADB) as part of efforts to raise funds to cope with severe food shortages, a Japanese newspaper reported on Saturday, quoting the head of the ADB.

The ADB will soon begin discussing Pyongyang's application with the Manila-based bank's 16 members, whose approval is required for new admissions, the Asahi Shimbun quoted ADB President Mitsuo Sato as saying.
"North Korea has shown strong interest in joining the ADB," Sato said in an interview with the Asahi in the western Japanese city of Fukuoka, site of the ADB's annual convention next month.
Sato said North Korea, believed to be on the brink of famine after two years of devastating floods, had made overtures to the ADB in February and March.
Food experts and humanitarian groups have said North Korea is facing serious food shortages that are likely to reach famine proportions in the next two months.
North Korea is due to respond to a joint U.S.-South Korean proposal for four-nation peace talks, which include China, in a meeting with the United States and South Korea on Saturday in New York.
The peace talks aim to secure a lasting peace on the Korean peninsula to replace a truce agreement that ended the 1950-53 Korean War.
